events.text:
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]BREAK TIME!
ORVENNN!
Herwin?

It’s you and food, you guys are my only friends.
Every other part of this world is trying to hurt meeee.

Don’t be silly, Herb.
Your hangover can’t be as bad as it was this morning.
Thanks to you! The quiet and dark really helped.
Haha, I heard Miss Odiche caught you sleeping.
And that helped me feel better!
You aren’t eating much, though? That’s weird for you.
I’m just nervous…what if we’re denied approval again?
Come onnn, after that speech?

We’ll be fine.
Even if things don’t work out, we’ll just keep going.

events.question: So long as Mister Avidine’s in charge, we’ll get there eventually, right?

events.choice: That’s true, we just have to trust in Mister Avidine.

events.text:
That’s true, Mister Avidine hasn’t steered us wrong yet, right?
We just need to make sure we support him.
He believes in us, so we need to believe in him!
What’s a general without an army behind him?
Tallest of men?
Tallest of men.

That’s true, Mister Avidine hasn’t steered us wrong yet, right?
We just need to make sure we support him.
He believes in us, so we need to believe in him!
Do you think he’s in his office?
To like, talk to?
Why, is that weird?

I mean, kinda—he’s the boss, right?
He can talk to us, but not the other way around.
Oh, right, right.
Plus, you wouldn’t wanna touch his door.
Yeah, he has it enchanted 24/7.
Mister Avidine can do magic???
YEAH, so magic ISN’T so weird, IS IT?
Yuck, maybe I can go when he’s not enchanting it?
Dude, what’s the use of an enchantment if it only works sometimes?
It works even when he’s at home or away on business trips.
I’m pretty sure that as long as Mister Avidine is around, you’re gonna have to deal with a magic door.
UGHHH.
So is magic cooler, or is Mister Avidine less cool, now that you know he can do magic?
It’s not that he’s LESS COOL.
[i]HAHA[/i]! Wow, not even Mister Avidine can save magic for you.
Does this count as a phobia?
Not a phobia!  It's just creepy!
Sure, man, haha! Let’s get back to work.

events.choice: I might try to look into things if we fail again.

events.text: I mean, you know how I feel about Mister Avidine.
Dude, the whole factory knows.

Ack—no, I mean, as much as I believe in him, the reality is that if we fail again…
I think something has to change.
I mean, we can’t just expect the result to change if we don’t change anything.
I’m sure they’ve changed things, but that’s for Mr. Gungand and Mister Avidine to figure out, right?
I just want to help out as much as I can, you know?

That’s the weight of responsibility that has been entrusted to us.
Like the whole point of being the tallest of men, was to hold up the sky.

I guess, dude.  
Just don’t get in trouble sticking your nose where it shouldn’t be.
Don’t worry, I don’t intend to! Gramma’s honor!
Come on, tall guy! Let’s get going.
I mean, you know how I feel about Mister Avidine.
Dude, the whole factory knows.

Ack—no, I mean, as much as I believe in him, the reality is that if we fail again…
I think something has to change.
I mean, we can’t just expect the result to change if we don’t change anything.
I’m sure they’ve changed things, but that’s for Mr. Gungand and Mister Avidine to figure out, right?
I just want to help out as much as I can, you know?

That’s the weight of responsibility that has been entrusted to us.
Like the whole point of being the tallest of men, was to hold up the sky.

I guess, dude.  
Just don’t get in trouble sticking your nose where it shouldn’t be.
You won’t like it.
What do you mean?
I can see you going to Mister Avidine’s office, and then getting weirded out by his door.
His door?
It’s magical.
What??? Why???
Mister Avidine has competitors and people who want his stuff!
He has to be careful!
So, if I want to go to his office, I’ll have to wait for him to leave work?

No, dude, it’s on, like, 24/7. Even when he’s home or on business trips.
If Mister Avidine is working, so is his door.
Magic makes no sense!!!
[i]HAHA![/i] Accept it, dude, it’s just how the world works.
NOT MY WORLD!
You’re ridiculous, haha. Come on, man, time to get back to work!
Somehow, I got through the morning shift…barely.
Let this be a warning for you, boy: you can get away with this because you’re young, but give it a couple of years, and it’s not going to be viable anymore.
Mrs. Langtree, you’re joining us outside for lunch?
Don’t get used to this—my old frame can’t handle sitting on the hard stone stairs every day.
What’s the occasion?
Orven?
Surprise! I made you both lunch!
DUDE!!! NO WAY!
Haha, I hope you like steak, onions, and tomatoes over rice!
Haha, I hope you like creamy shrimp pasta with asparagus on the side!
Haha, I hope you like chorizo and egg breakfast sandwiches for lunch!
That sounds AMAZING.

Eat up, guys!
A little token of my thanks for making my first month here so great!
You truly are too good, precious child.
This is INCREDIBLE.

I’m telling you, you can TAKE Gusace and Sterling.
Not that their stuff is bad! Your stuff is just [i]that[/i] good.
Stop spreading rumors!

Plus, Gusace loves a good competition, she’s a good sport.
She’s honestly just here for any kind of show, win or lose.
Help me out, Mrs. Langtree!

I don’t know, Orven, this is pretty delicious.
You’re welcome at my home anyday.
…Oh!
Hmm? What’s up, dude?
Talking about the Tavern reminded me, do you guys know anyone named Flaire?

DUDE, what?
I thought you were smart.
There’s one, like, public-figure Flaire, and that’s Flaire Avidine.

!!!
WAIT, SO SHE’S–

The Boss Man’s wife?
Yep.
[i]I’m officially an idiot.
Why do you ask?

Oh no…
Because I think I made a fool of myself in front of her yesterday.
She was at the Tavern???
Mhmm, by the bar.
Can’t blame the woman for wanting to get out.
She’s beautiful.
They’re quite the attractive couple, and their kids are adorable.
You’ve seen their kids?
A couple times around town, the factory isn’t a great place for kids to be roaming.
That makes sense.
I heard his kids like that franchise cafe, All Bread Patisserie.

The food there is always better than you think.
Always.

I should try it some day.
Bread is something I want to get into.

Well, no rush because what you’re doing is just fine. 
Thank you for the meal, Orven, it was delicious.
Yeah, dude, I’ll eat whatever you make for me, whenever.

Herwin, you should be learning to make food, not mooching off of Orven.
You’re older than him!

Ughh, you always bring that up, Mrs. Langtree.
I’ll learn to cook soon, I just have no motivation when my mom cooks for us.

You sound just like my sons.
And I haven’t been able to convince them either.
Haha, well, maybe I’ll cook something up once we officially go public with [b]Remedium[/b]!
We’ll definitely pass this time, right?
Our track record doesn’t have the same confidence as you.

Come on, Mrs. Langtree, we have to do well.
I mean, didn’t you hear Mister Avidine?

events.choice: I think all we need to do is trust in Mister Avidine and in Remedium.

events.text: I think Mister Avidine hasn’t done anything to make us believe he doesn’t have everything under control.

See, Mrs. Langtree?
You just gotta have a little faith!

Ah, to be young...just be careful, boys.
Things tend not to work out the way you think they will.

But, they eventually work out! So we don’t have to sweat.
Right, Orven?
I mean, I think?

Mister Avidine believes in us, we need to believe in him!
We’re his tallest men!
Haha, true, true.

events.choice: I think, if things don’t work, we should probably look into Remedium.

events.text: Not that I don’t think things will work out–
Not [i]you[/i], Orven, you love Mister Avidine!

Not LOVE!
But I’m trying to be realistic, Herb.
If we want this project to succeed, we might need to help it out a little.

It’ll work out!
Remember, it’s not a “what,” but a “who!”
Mister Avidine believes in his “Tallest of Men”.

Herb, it’s not just that we’re “tall.”
We have gifts and that comes with responsibilities.
Like we have to help because we have the opportunities and the talents to help.
Remember “The Tallest of Men” are there to hold up the sky.
We just work in Production, Orven, that’s for those in the upper levels to work out.
But I feel like we’re not helping out if things just continue as they are.

Then, that’s their problem.
Orven, don’t let this job take over your life.
It’s not your responsibility.

You both are such buzz kills!
Come onnn.
True, what’s good was the meal Orven cooked for us.
True, that was great dude.
I’m glad you guys like the meal!
Dude, it’s so good.

Oh!
Before you finish, Herb, I’ve got a game for you!
Nooo, not the spice game! I’m gonna suck!
You can play too, Mrs. Langtree, if you want!
What is the “Spice Game?”
It’s when you guess which of these spices I used in the meal!

[i]Haha![/i] I’ll pass, I think I’ve got this down.
Is this how you got good at cooking, Orven?
Initially! My Gramma used to play this with me.
Here, Herb, you can smell them.
But none of them smell like this!
Just try to guess one!

…...
Salt. Pepper?

Come on, those are given.
Try to get one more!
Duddee.

This is how you get good at cooking!
Just try and take a bite—here, I’ll just make it between three choices.
It’s either Garlic Powder, Cumin, or Oregano.

…...
I dont taste the Cumin...
I don’t know what Oregano is, but I don’t think it’s in there, either?
Yes! You’re right! It’s garlic powder!
That’s the biggest secret: everything tastes good with garlic powder.
That’s a fact.
[i]Haha[/i], thanks. That wasn’t too bad.
So, next time, [i]you[/i] can cook for Orven.
I still think I’m far off from that, though.
It’s all steps, and this was the first one!
[i]Haha[/i], you don’t have to be [i]this[/i] excited.
Trying and risking failure—that’s what “Tall Men” do, right?

[i]HAHA![/i] You’re so right!
Hey, we’ll definitely pass this time, right?
Our track record doesn’t have the same confidence as you.

Come on, Mrs. Langtree, we have to do well.
I mean, didn’t you hear Mister Avidine?

events.choice: I think all we need to do is trust in Mister Avidine and in Remedium.

events.text: I think Mister Avidine hasn’t done anything to make us believe he doesn’t have everything under control.

See, Mrs. Langtree?
You just gotta have a little faith!

Ah, to be young. Just be careful, boys.
Things tend not to work out the way you think they will.
But, they eventually work out! So we don’t have to sweat.
Right, Orven?
I mean, I think?

Mister Avidine believes in us, we need to believe in him!
We’re his tallest men!
[i]Haha[/i], true, true.

events.choice: I think if things don’t work, we should probably look into Remedium.

events.text: Not that I don’t think things will work out—
Not [i]you[/i]! Orven, you [i]love[/i] Mister Avidine!
Not LOVE!

But I’m trying to be realistic, Herb.
If we want this project to succeed, we might need to help it out a little.

It’ll work out!
Remember, it’s not a “what,” but a “who!” Mister Avidine believes in his “Tallest of Men”.

Herb, it’s not just that we’re “tall.”
We have gifts, and that comes with responsibilities.
Like, we have to help because we have the opportunities and the talents to help.
Remember, “The Tallest of Men” are there to hold up the sky.
We just work in Production, Orven—that’s for those in the upper levels to work out.
But I feel like we’re not helping out, if things just continue as they are.
Then, that’s their problem, so don’t let this job take over your life. It’s not your responsibility.
You both are such buzzkills! Come onnn.
True, what’s good was the meal Orven cooked for us.
True, that was great, dude.
Time to head back to hear the good news?
Thanks, again, boys, for having me for lunch!
Thanks for joining us, Mrs. Langtree!
[color=#ffed29](I hope it’s good news that’s waiting for us…)
[color=#ffed29](Halfway through the day. I should check on Mister Avidine.)
[color=#ffed29](Not the magic door again…)

[color=#ffed29](Let’s see if I can do this without touching the door this time.)
Mister Avidine?
Mister Avidine?
Orven Zanry?
AH!
My apologies, I didn’t mean to startle you.
Your magic still goes even if you’re not in the room?
The magic will persist so long as I will it to, regardless of my location.
[color=#ffed29](Gross, so if I ever want to talk to Mister Avidine, I’ll need to touch the magic door.)
Is there any time when it’s [i]not[/i] enchanted?
For safety reasons, I have it always magically locked.
The only time it would be disenchanted is if I am rendered incapable of enchanting it.
Oh.
[color=#ffed29](Dang it.)
I’m sorry if I displeased you by startling you.

No! No, that was my bad.
I just didn’t expect you to appear behind me.

I was rinsing your tupperware.
Here you are.
Thanks, man, you really didn’t have to wash it.
What did you think?
As expected, the meal was delicious.
Another way in which Orven Zanry is exceptional.

Seriously, sir, you’re too kind.
Everything I have is from my Gramma.
You know what they say about apples and trees.
You must be proud of your kids, then!

Endlessly.
Lunette is a genius pianist and an extremely bright child.
I find conversations with her more insightful than those I hold with most adults.
And Matty is endlessly joyful, and a delight to all that behold him.
His company is also preferable to most people.

The way you talk about them, I’m sure they’re proud that you’re their dad.
Just like how I am to be my Gramma’s son.
I do everything in my power to make this so.
Mister Avidine?
Are you concerned about the reveal of the results today?
Do you already know if we were approved?
No, Sion is heading to the apotheca now.
What will you do if we don’t pass again?
I will do what I always do, which is whatever must be done.

events.question: What will you do, Orven Zanry?

events.text: I’ll do whatever you want me to do.
I told you that I’m indebted to you. I’m here for the long haul.

…...
I believe I told you my intentions yesterday. I want you to think beyond me and this factory.
Yeah, but…
Perhaps these personal meetings have been unhelpful to you.
No, sir!
I do not wish to be clouding your judgment further.
I appreciate the meal, but this is the final one.
And if you have things to discuss with me, please let it be pertinent to work, and go through your manager Miss Odiche.
Mister Avidine, I’m so sorry…I didn’t mean to…

No, it is I who should apologize. I crossed the boundary and made this relationship personal.
You do not have any fault, it is entirely mine.
Mister Avidine…
Orven Zanry, be well.
[color=#ffed29](What just happened? What did I do?)
I’ll do what I can.
If I am truly as gifted as you say, then I gotta use my gifts for something, right?
Have you been thinking about what we discussed last night?
Yeah, or…trying to.
No real ideas yet…
Well done.
But for now, these gifts can help with [b]Remedium[/b], and, by extension, everyone that’s sick right now.
While I’m here, I’ll do whatever I can to do the most good I can.

Your efforts are appreciated.
Did you eat before coming up to my office?
Oh, no, sir. I came up first.
Feel free to finish your meal here. I have to discuss the results with Sion.
Stay, so long as Herwin doesn’t mind missing out on his lunch with you.

No worries, I told him when we were working that I wouldn’t be able to eat with him.
Plus, he’s a little exhausted, so I think some time alone might do him well.

[i]chuckle
Very well.
Take care, Orven.
Take care, Mister Avidine!
[color=#ffed29](I hope we pass…)
